metaphor_systems.name: Light and Darkness
metaphor_systems.description: Hope, the American Dream, and the tension between aspiration and moral corruption. The green light as the central symbol of the unattainable.

metaphor_systems.name: Water and Drowning
metaphor_systems.description: Time's flow, desire, and ultimate futility. Water as both life-giving and fatal, culminating in the novel's final metaphor of boats against the current.

metaphor_systems.name: Vision and Surveillance
metaphor_systems.description: The absent God, faded moral authority, and seeing without acting. Doctor Eckleburg's eyes as the novel's most haunting image of judgment without intervention.

metaphor_systems.name: Time and the Past
metaphor_systems.description: The impossibility of repeating the past, clocks, seasons, and Gatsby's doomed attempt to recreate what was. Time as the novel's ultimate antagonist.

metaphor_systems.name: Money as Substance
metaphor_systems.description: Wealth as an intrinsic quality rather than an acquisition. Class privilege made audible, visible, and tangible throughout the novel.
examples: Her voice is full of money

metaphor_systems.name: Nature Perverted
metaphor_systems.description: The natural order inverted by industrial capitalism. Ashes that grow like wheat, moths drawn to fatal light, flowers crushed under the weight of corruption.
